sect1.title: CORRELATION

row.entry: The set of records to process. This may be the name of a dataset or a record set derived from some filter condition, or any expression that results in a derived record set. This also may be the GROUP keyword to indicate operating on the elements in each group, when used in a RECORD structure to generate crosstab statistics.
Optional. A logical expression indicating which records to include in the calculation. Valid only when the recset parameter is the keyword GROUP.
Optional. Specifies the activity is part of an index read operation, which allows the optimizer to generate optimal code for the operation.
CORRELATION returns a single REAL value.

sect1.para: The CORRELATION function returns the Pearson's Product Moment Correlation Coefficient between valuex and valuey.
